data.title: Good breakfast!
data.text: Was waiting for my truck to be serviced at Firestone, so I went across the street for breakfast at JB's.  Been here before, and it's a good family restaurant.  Had the pancake special.  Brought back good memories of pancakes I had growing up.  Pancakes, bacon and eggs all good, and very prompt service.

data.title: Stopped for breakfast...
data.text: On my way to the customer location I stopped for breakfast.  The restaurant really seems to be dating itself and certainly needs a facelift and updating.  Looks pretty old inside and out.  Seats are torn and just not maintained.  Buffet seemed like a deal at only $8.95.  Food was not that bad although was pretty basic.  Service was not good.  Ordered 2 eggs and never got them.  They never came around to ask if I needed a drink refill or if everything was OK.  Not very impressed.  Does not surprise me that there are only a few excellent reviews.

data.title: Can only say - we didn't stay
data.text:
Went in for lunch on a Sunday about noon. Saw the soup and salad bar sign and it sounded good. While my husband ordered our Cokes I went to look at the salad bar. It was still brunch so there wasn't one. Understandable.
The breakfast bar had not been tended to for a while and was dirty, messy and plain sad looking. I went back to the table (which was dirty) where the server was telling my husband they were out of coke but we could have dr. pepper. I did not sit down and said we were not staying. She again insisted we could have dr. pepper. :O) We cannot review the food since we left and found an awesome sports bar.

data.title: Good eats
data.text: A good place to stop for a bite. Food is good with large selection, and a salad bar. They also have a good selection of pies, very good. The service is fast and food gets to your table hot. It is very easy to get in and out of parking.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: JB's has really good food.  The restaurant is very outdated and needs a face lift in the worst way.  The service is spotty.  One time the service can be phenomenal, other times the service is very poor.  The food quality stays pretty constant though.  JB's is a good value for the money and you won't walk away hungry.  the restaurant is conveniently located and easy to get in and out of especially if your from out of town.

data.title: A good restaurant with a good soup and salad bar
data.text:
When we are in Great Falls, we always have a meal at JB’s. We especially like the salad and soup bar and often only have that.  They keep it filled up. Service is good as there are several wait staff.
We will occasionally order off the menu and found the food is reasonable. 
The place needs redecorating, but we go for the food, not the ambience. The Men’s washroom appears to have been upgraded recently.

data.title: First time to JB's in 33 years
data.text: The last time I was at a JB's I was a kid. It was exactly how I remember it. Hey it might not exactly be pristine but that's what it's about a greasy spoon and good food. I ate breakfast and dinner there and was not disappointed nor was my family or inlaws. For value and price you can't beat it.

data.title: PIE!
data.text:
The Strawberry Pie is excellent. Great food bar! Lots of choices, very clean! 
Great service! Lots of parking, which is hard to find in some places on 10th AVE S.

data.title: A good place to eat, especially the salad and soup bar
data.text:
When we are in Great Falls, we always have a meal at JB’s. We especially like the salad and soup bar and often only have that.  They keep it filled up. Service is good as there are several wait staff.
We will occasionally order off the menu and found the food is reasonable. 
The place needs redecorating, but we go for the food, not the ambience. The Men’s washroom appears to have been upgraded recently.

data.title: A restaurant within walking distance
data.text: Asked the staff at the Super 8 I stayed at where a good restaurant to eat at nearby and they said JB's was a good place   Went I got there it was around 5:30pm and not very crowded  I wondered if I had made a bad choice, but I did not. I got the Tuesday night special, grilled hamburger steak and onions and brown gravy. It came with nice size garden salad, mashed potatoes and Texas toast. Price was $8.49. For desert I a hand dipped strawberry shake. Very pleased with JB's

data.title: Quick Bite
data.text:
Came in after returning from the cabin and deciding not to cook. Viki always likes the omlet and I usually get one of the daily specials. Tonight, however, I went for the cheeseburger with pepperjack and a side of onion rings. The peach iced tea was really good. Light and not overwhelming. Unfortunately, their servings are generous so I never have room for dessert. Maybe I should start with that next time. As usual, Teresa our waitress, was pleasant, efficient and accurate. 

Next time, soup and salad bar. I think.

data.title: Poor Quality Family Style Restaurant
data.text: We stopped after a long day of travel looking for a good family style meal. The service was very slow. We both ordered  the same meal. The meat was burned to the point of having a black crust. It was totally inedible. The potatoes tasted like instant.When we complained about the meat all we got was I'm sorry and would you like desert?

data.title: Local Diner
data.text: So this restaurant is your typical local diner. The food was pretty good for what it was and the service too. Yeah, it's not pristine, but it's got character and I enjoyed my dinner.

data.title: Always Available in a Pinch
data.text: We went last night 'cause we didn't want to cook. Service was prompt and pleasant. My wife had the turkey dinner which she enjoyed and there was enough food to bring home. I did my usual salad bar but also had their spaghetti plate. The pasta was done well and handled appropriately so that their nicely thick meat sauce did not slide off in a watery pool of liquid at the bottom of the plate. Many restaurants can't get this right but this night they did. Good parmesan toast. Always a good spot with usually timely service, decent prices. Decor, seat coverings, woodwork pretty beat and could certainly use a major update, but then, the prices would probably sky rocket. So, I guess it's ok just the way it is...especially only 6 blocks away.

data.title: Lunch Salad Bar
data.text: We both wanted just salad for lunch. The food is good .   Really time to do an upgrade on the place  .  Paint, new seating would be the difference.    I have ate at this loca for decades. Please up date and dont close****

data.title: Yikes
data.text: Food was decent, but the restaurant is dirty. This is a picture of the basket containing jams and jellies. The restroom doors are equally as filthy.

data.title: Salad bar with a side of dinner
data.text: Because I stay at the Townhouse Inn quite a bit,  JB's is close by. Even in January. I often go here because they have a salad bar. Just order whatever is the special with the salad bar and you have a good meal. Not a steakhouse but not fast food either. Never expensive but not cheap either. But the wait staff has never done me wrong. Attentive at all times. Thanks!

data.title: Poor service, poor food
data.text:
My wife, daughter, grand son and myself visited this restaurant because it was beside the hotel we stayed at. We came in and my wife and daughter ordered the special, 1/2 sandwich, barley soup and dessert. I ordered the fried chicken and the grandson had fries.
The soup and sandwich came out first and their soup was stone cold so we sent it back. They said their sandwich was good. The waitress brought the soup back and set it down. It was still cold. (had to bring the soup back twice to get it right!) My chicken came with a salad and toast. She forgot this and brought the steak out and I had to ask her for it. I did not want my supper to get cold so when she brought the salad I was half way through my meal and did not eat it. She then forgot to get the pies and we had to ask for them.

It looked like the people in the back were friends or family because she made sure they were looked after.

I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

data.title: Winner, Winner, Chicken Fried Chicken Dinner
data.text: Like and old glove, this place while not fancy has a pretty decent chicken fried chicken meal with a real chicken breast and not some pressed wonder meat. With a side of mashed potatoes/ country gravy and veggie along with parmesan toast, this is a nice reliable plate in a pinch. And you can't beat the price from the seniors menu. Add an all you can eat soup and salad bar and you're good to go. Nothin' fancy but who cares.

data.title: Over Priced and Poor Service
data.text: We stopped in for a late lunch at the end of a vacation.  The place was about 1/4 full.  We had the salad bar, Rubens, a burger and chicken.  All of the fried foods were so greasy we could not finish.  The corn beef was terrible.  The waitress failed to bring us our drinks, then when we asked for refills she never came back. Yet she did manage to drop the check off.   It was a very disappointing meal.
